thorwin.math

Class Affine3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • thorwin.math.Affine3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Matrix

    public final class Affine3D
extends java.lang.Object
    Affine matrix for transforming Vector3D instances.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Affine3D

        public Affine3D(Vector3D mx,
                Vector3D my,
                Vector3D mz,
                Vector3D t)
        Constructs an affine using four vectors for the getColumnDimension.
        Parameters:
        mx - first column
        my - second column
        mz - third column
        t - fourth column

      • Affine3D

        public Affine3D(double mxx,
                double mxy,
                double mxz,
                double tx,
                double myx,
                double myy,
                double myz,
                double ty,
                double mzx,
                double mzy,
                double mzz,
                double tz)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        mxx - Row 0, column 0
        mxy - Row 0, column 1
        mxz - Row 0, column 2
        tx - Row 0, column 3
        myx - Row 1, column 0
        myy - Row 1, column 1
        myz - Row 1, column 2
        ty - Row 1, column 3
        mzx - Row 2, column 0
        mzy - Row 2, column 1
        mzz - Row 2, column 2
        tz - Row 2, column 3

      • lookAt

        public static Affine3D lookAt(Vector3D eye,
                              Vector3D target,
                              Vector3D eyeUp)
        Constructs a look-at toAffine3D. Note that for camera view you need to invert this matrix.
        Parameters:
        eye - position of the camera
        target - center to look at
        eyeUp - vector indicating 'up'
        Returns:
        new affine
